column1: John McCain called the crisis with Iran the most serious crisis we have faced – outside of the entire war on terror – since the end of the Cold War." "Nuclear capability in Iran is unacceptable
column2: said McCain. McCain criticized Russia and China for causing gridlock" in the UN Security Council and preventing the sanctioning of Iran as well as other areas of conflict such as Darfur and Burma. If elected
column3: McCain pledges to create a "league of democracies" with the purpose of addressing those conflicts without the approval of China and Russia.[99][100]"
column5: Obama stated he regards Iran's government as a threat to all of us
column6: stating that the US should take no option
column8: off the table. Sustained and aggressive diplomacy combined with tough sanctions should be our primary means to prevent Iran from building nuclear weapons."[101]"

column2: Has stated that an attack on Iran would be unnecessary
column6: and only an imminent threat can ever justify a preemptive strike"
column7: and concludes "any nonproliferation strategy must begin with diplomacy and include a willingness to address the other side".[102]"
column8: McKinney believes we must leave behind the militarization that has accompanied the Bush administration. She supports leaving Iraq and moving toward peaceful methods of dealing with other countries.[103]
column9: Nader believes the US must stop “saber rattling” with Iran and take up Iran's proposal in 2003 to negotiate all outstanding issues between the US and Iran.[89]
